attributes.action: Urgent impact from government to prevent extreme consequences of climate change
attributes.additional_details:
A recent report conducted by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) states that we have approximately 11 to 12 years to prevent catastrophe in terms of climate change and global warming. 

Urgent action needs to take place. 

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/25-year-environment-plan/25-year-environment-plan-our-targets-at-a-glance
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/oct/08/global-warming-must-not-exceed-15c-warns-landmark-un-report
attributes.background: In 2018, the Secretary of State for the Environment produced a 25 year Environment plan to improve the damage and harm caused by human beings. Although this is a step forward in the right direction, it is important these "targets" - some set for 2050 - come into affect much sooner than suggested.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about climate change but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You might also like to sign one of these petitions: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/231038 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/230041
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/234717 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/231518
